## Second-Year MHS Student in Epidemiology at Johns Hopkins Univeristy

Yingying possesses an ingrained passion for creating a substantial influence in the realm of oncology. With a foundation in cell and molecular biology, she discovered a growing attraction to the domain of data science and bioinformatics. This shift occurred as she recognized the capacity of data-driven insights to revolutionize comprehension of intricate biological processes.

## Her previous/current research

-   Chromosome segregation in human cells and its regulation by Spindle Assembly Checkpoint (SAC)
-   Identify potential marker metabolites using mass spectroscopy data
-   Identify novel isoforms of interferon-stimulated genes using RNA-seq data
-   Association of parity and breastfeeding with breast cancer prognosis

## Educational training

Yingying received her B.A. in Biology from New York University (2022) and her MHS from the Department of Epidemiology at Johns Hopkins University (2024) under the direction of Dr. Kala Visvanathan
